channel.title: Update JLabel?
channel.description:
I am trying to update a JLabel on my GUI with the information stored inside int score. Here is the code for my label:
[code] JLabel gameLabel = new JLabel("Guessing Game Score: " + score); contentPane.add(gameLabel, BorderLayout.SOUTH); [/code]
Every time the user gets the correct answer, int score goes up by one. However, it doesn't update that in the GUI, only internally. How do I update information in the JLabel without making the frame again?
I have tried calling my makeFrame() method again, but that just makes two different games but it does update the information. I tried calling frame.pack() and frame.makeVisible(true) but that had no effect on updating it on the GUI, which I didn't think it would. If I were to try to make a new frame and then call System.exit(0) it would just close both frames. I have ran out of ideas so I'm asking you if you could please help me.
I also want to make a reset score option which sets the score to 0 and updates the GUI.
Thanks for the help, FireEater93

item.title: Update JLabel?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

when you create an object such as a JLabel and use [tt]JLabel("Guessing Game Score: " + score)[/tt]

the argument becomes [tt]"Guessing Game Score: " + currentValueOfscore[/tt] or [tt]"Guessing Game Score: " + 0[/tt] which would just come out as [tt]new JLabel(“Guessing Game Score: 0”)[/tt]

to update its text you do [tt]jlabel.setText("");[/tt]
